contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox park | name = Vander Veer Botanical Park | photo = Vanderveer 1 030.jpg | photo_width = 250 | photo_caption = The lagoon at Vander Veer Park | type = Public park | location = [[Davenport, Iowa]] | coords = {{coord|41|32|37.68|N|90|34|30.72|W||display=inline}} | area = {{convert|33|acre|km2|adj=on}} | created = 1885 | operator = Davenport Parks and Recreation | visitation_num = | status = | open = All year | embedded = {{Designation list | embed = yes | designation1 = Davenport Register of Historic Properties | designation1_date = August 4, 1993<ref name ="DRHP_list"/> | designation1_number = }} }} The '''Vander Veer Botanical Park''' is a {{convert|33|acre|m2|adj=on}} [[botanical garden]] in the [[Vander Veer Park Historic District]] of [[Davenport, Iowa|Davenport]], [[Iowa]]. It is believed to be one of the first botanical parks west of the [[Mississippi River]]. The park was listed on the [[Davenport Register of Historic Properties]] on August 4, 1993.<ref name ="DRHP_list">{{cite web |author=Historic Preservation Commission|title=Davenport Register of Historic Properties|publisher=City of Davenport|url=http://www.cityofdavenportiowa.com/egov/docs/1157124087_589019.pdf |accessdate = 2011-03-16}}</ref> Vander Veer Park was established in 1885. The city of Davenport purchased the land for $13,000 (${{Inflation|US|13000|1885}} in {{CURRENTYEAR}} dollars).{{Inflation-fn|US}}<ref name="Vander Veer">{{cite web|title=Vander Veer Botanical Park|publisher=[[Davenport Public Library]]|url=http://www.davenportlibrary.com/files/5313/2586/6626/Vander_Veer_Botanical_Park.pdf|date=|accessdate=2008-01-18}}</ref> The park was built on the old Scott County Fairgrounds land and modeled after [[New York City]]â€™s [[Central Park]].<ref name="Vander Veer"/> Vander Veer was originally named Central Park. In 1912 the park was renamed after the first secretary of the Davenport Park Board of Commissioners, A.W. Vander Veer.<ref name="Vander Veer"/>A conservatory, music pavilion, and decorative fountains were added after World War I.<ref name="Vander Veer"/> == See also == * [[List of botanical gardens in the United States]] ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Image:Vander Veer Botanical Park.jpg|left|thumb|250px|Vander Veer Botanical Park]] {{Quad Cities}} {{Davenport}} {{coord|41.5438|-90.5752|type:landmark_region:US-IA|display=title}} [[Category:Botanical gardens in Iowa]] [[Category:Davenport Register of Historic Properties]] [[Category:Parks in Davenport, Iowa]] [[Category:Historic district contributing properties in Iowa]]
